messages.title: Corbyn's Brexit Delay = Threat to Jobs
messages.content: Boris Johnson has secured a Brexit deal with the EU. And as the Bank of England chief says, the deal is positive for the UK economy. That's because the deal protects jobs and trade. Protects workers' rights and environmental standards. And ends the uncertainty facing our economy. We can’t afford five more years of delay. But that’s all Jeremy Corbyn would deliver. Instead of getting Brexit done, Corbyn wants to delay it. Holding a second referendum and unleashing more arguments and more uncertainty. That means priorities like the NHS, police and schools won’t get the investment they need. Don’t you think it’s time to stop arguing about the past – and start building the kind of future we want? Let’s get Brexit done. Let’s unleash Britain’s potential. Don’t risk more delay with five years of Corbyn.

messages.title: Let’s Unleash Britain’s Potential
messages.content: Let’s get Brexit done. Let’s get on with the country’s priorities.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: £33.9 billion extra for the NHS. 40 new hospitals across the country.
30 million more trees for cleaner air.
More funding for every pupil in every school.
£3.6 billion to help towns invest and attract new businesses.
Gigabit broadband for the whole country.

issues.brexitEurope: Let’s get Brexit done. Let’s not risk more delay with five years of Corbyn. More delay and uncertainty on Brexit just means more damage to the economy.

quotes.text: We simply cannot afford another wasted year of political paralysis.
Brexit uncertainty and delays lead to job losses and holds back economy.
Mark Carney: Brexit deal ‘positive’ for UK economy
